content.description: This short route is good for someone who is new to climbing, as it presents very few challenges.
content.location: This route is the furthest left on the back crag section. There are two anchors at the top, which can be easily accessed from a very short hike up around the left side of the face.

content.description: Start at the smaller crack to the left of back crack then push up and over the small overhang. Two anchors for top rope easily accessible from walk around.
content.location: Just to left of back crack on Back Crag

content.description: Big obvious crack in the middle of the Back Crag. Good opportunities to place protection all the way up to double bolt anchors. This would be a good first trad climb for new leaders.
content.protection: Small to medium sized cams. Double bolt anchors at the top.

content.description: This small crag has around 5 easy routes with double bolt anchors at the top. The top of the crag/anchors are easily accessible, so it is easy to set up top-rope for these routes. Crag ranges from 30-40 ft.
